questiontext.text: 1. A 50-year-old woman comes to the dentist with gingival complaints that bleed easily and is full of redness. After an intraoral examination, a 5mm deep periodontal pocket was carried out behind the lower jaw while the X-ray showed a vertical damage in the area. Are cytokines requested in such bone conditions?

answer.text: Acute inflammation completion of Il-1a secretion
Chronic inflammation and secretion of Il-6 and PGE2

questiontext.text: 2. A 50-year-old female patient comes to the dentist with complaints of gingival bleeding that is easy to compile brushing teeth and differences in tooth shake in the posterior region of the lower jaw. After an intraoral examination is obtained there are calculus and periodontal pockets as deep as 6 mm. X-rays showed damage to the vertical bone in the area. What are the main etiological bacteria in the disease?

3. A 50-year-old female patient comes to the dentist with complaints of gingival bleeding that is easy to compile brushing teeth and differences in tooth shake in the posterior region of the lower jaw. After an intraoral examination is obtained there are calculus and periodontal pockets as deep as 6 mm. What is the main causative factor in the above case?

4. A 50-year-old female patient comes to the dentist complaining of a gums that is easily bleed to compilation, brushing teeth and the color of the gums is dark red to purple. After an intraoral examination, the calculus is collected. What causes the gum discoloration above?

answer.text: Vasoconstriction and permeability of microcirculation decreases
Vasodilation and permeability of the micro circulation increases

The temporary layoff has long been released and when obtained it appears that caries lesions have increased in depth to deep. How are bacteria involved in the process of dental caries?

questiontext.text: 25. Transmission of cross infections in dental practice is known by means, but what rarely happens is:

26. A clinical trial was conducted on 20 monkeys to determine the effectiveness of the newly discovered caries vaccine. All monkeys underwent various oral health screenings and controls. Vaccines are antigens that have cariogenic bacteria colonization receptors and the antibodies formed are expected to be able to inhibit the colonization. What is the name of the antigen receptor?

27. During an operation, an oral surgeon accidentally injures a patient's gingiva with a sharp instrument. This causes Streptococcus, normal flora of the oral cavity bacteria, to enter the bloodstream to the heart and result in sub bacterial endocarditis. What kind of infection have occured in this patient?

30. A researcher presents the results of the laboratory examination of bacteria Â“XÂ” which is declared to have the hyaluronidase enzyme. What is the virulence factor of this enzyme?

answer.text: Ability to attach to host cells

questiontext.text: 31. A 32-year-old woman with a history of type 1 Diabetes Mellitus came to the Dental Hospital with complaints of bad breath. Clinical examination showed that the back of the tongue was covered with a white layer, the mucosa was dry and the lips were cracked. To determine the involvement of microorganisms, the dentist performs tongue scraping and sends the sample to the laboratory using special media. What is the special media?

32. A 32-years-old woman with a history of type 1 Diabetes Mellitus came to the General Hospital with complaints of bad breath. Clinical examination showed that the back of the tongue was covered with a white layer, the mucosa was dry and the lips were cracked. To determine the involvement of microorganisms, the dentist performs tongue scraping and sends the sample to the laboratory. The initial identification carried out by the laboratory for bacterial colonies was gram staining which after staining with safranin showed purple bacteria. In what order of the gram stains do these materials use?

33. A group of cariogenic bacteria in dental plaque is a weak and minority group. Due to environmental changes due to carbohydrate fermentation, the pH becomes more acidic and causes these bacteria to develop because they are classified as acid tolerant bacteria. What is the plaque hypothesis that supports this theory?:

34. A 37-years-old man is brought to the emergency department with swelling of the front of the neck, fever and difficulty breathing. Dental history revealed mandibular first molar had extracted 2 weeks ago. Intra-oral examination revealed a raised tongue due to swelling of the floor of the mouth and tooth sockets that had not healed. Panoramic results show an expanding radiolucent image indicating that there were a lot of pus. The diagnosis was Ludwig's angina. What commensal bacteria are most often isolated from the patient's pus?

35. At a coffe shop, COVID-19 screening was carried out with antigen swabs to several customers. The results showed 35% of customers tested positive. The authorities then educate customers and coffe shop managers to strictly to the health protocol procedures. Based on the classification of viruses, the virus specifications are:

answer.text: RNA virus, unenveloped, double stranded, non-segmented genome
RNA virus, enveloped, double stranded, non-segmented genome
RNA virus, unenveloped, single stranded, non-segmented genome
RNA virus, enveloped, single stranded, non-segmented genome
DNA virus, enveloped, double stranded, non-segmented genome

The initial examination is to determine the donor's blood group by immunological method in which the antigen-antibody reaction will form a clot. What is the type of antigen-antibody reaction?

37. A 25-years-old woman came to the Dental Hospital with complaints of swollen gums, throbbing pain, especially when biting. Intra-oral examination revealed no carious teeth but swelling of the periapical area of the maxillary right first premolar was seen. The patient uses orthodontic appliances and is cared for by a dental nurse in his hometown. The radiograph shows a periapical radiolucency. Pus was found from the periodontal pocket and laboratory results were the majority of anaerobic Gram-negative rods, particularly black-pigmented Porphyromonas, Prevotella spp., and fusobacteria. What infection does this patient have ?

answer.text: Long term systemic effect where ingested fluoride integrates with enamel to form fluoroapatite
Systemic effects of fluoride integrate into enamel during enamel formation

questiontext.text: 53. Found the body of an unidentified male, approximately 17 years old, suspected of being a murder victim. The condition of the charred corpse was so hard to identify. To find out the identity of the victim, a DNA test was carried out. What method does this test belong to?:
54. Robert Koch declares how to identify disease-causing bacteria. What is the following statement has contrary with Koch's postulates?

answer.text: Microorganisms must be transmitted according to the extent of the lesion found
Microorganisms must be found in all (certain) diseases
Microorganisms from experimental animals can cause disease in humans
Microorganisms must be able to be cultured in vitro within one generation
Pure cultures of microorganisms can cause infection in experimental animals

56. There are three transmission precautions in dental practice, namely airborne, droplet and contact precautions that is used to minimize the risk of cross infection. Below are the transmission precautions for airborne precautions:

answer.text: Use a respirator that filters 95% of airborne particles or an air-purifying respirator with a HEPA filter
Use handscoen and gown before entering the patient room and remove immediately after leaving the room
Patient is placed in a special room with a minimum distance of 1 meter

questiontext.text: 57. There are three transmission precautions in dental practice, namely airborne, droplet and contact precatuions that is used to minimize the risk of cross infection. Below are the transmission precautions for droplet precaution:

answer.text: Patient is placed in a negative-pressure room
Use a respirator that filters 95% of airborne particles or an air-purifying respirator with a HEPA filter
Patient should use a special room, but if the room is not avalaible then we need to consider the microorgansim epidemiology and the number of patients
Use handscoen and gown before entering the patient room and remove immediately after leaving the room

questiontext.text: 58. For standard protection against COVID-19 in dental clinics, there are four levels of protection, namely general protection, primary protection, secondary protection, and advanced protection. Secondary protection is addressed to:

answer.text: Dental personnel in contact with confirmed patients
Dental personnel who treat patients with fever
Dental personnel who come into contact with patients with suspected respiratory infections
Dental personnel who treat patients without suspected COVID-19 symptoms
